<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SI Machine Scheduler interface</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/simachinescheduler-h">SIMachineScheduler.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/lib/target/amdgpu/mctargetdesc/amdgpumctargetdesc-h">MCTargetDesc/AMDGPUMCTargetDesc.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siinstrinfo-h">SIInstrInfo.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h">llvm/CodeGen/LiveIntervals.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineregisterinfo-h">llvm/CodeGen/MachineRegisterInfo.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22" lineLink="#ad78e062f62e0d6e453941fb4ca843e4d"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define DEBUG&#95;TYPE &quot;machine-scheduler&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This scheduler implements a different scheduling algorithm than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// GenericScheduler.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There are several specific architecture behaviours that can&#39;t be modelled</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for GenericScheduler:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . When accessing the result of an SGPR load instruction, you have to wait</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for all the SGPR load instructions before your current instruction to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// have finished.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . When accessing the result of an VGPR load instruction, you have to wait</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for all the VGPR load instructions previous to the VGPR load instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// you are interested in to finish.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . The less the register pressure, the best load latencies are hidden</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Moreover some specifities (like the fact a lot of instructions in the shader</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// have few dependencies) makes the generic scheduler have some unpredictable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// behaviours. For example when register pressure becomes high, it can either</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// manage to prevent register pressure from going too high, or it can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// increase register pressure even more than if it hadn&#39;t taken register</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pressure into account.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Also some other bad behaviours are generated, like loading at the beginning</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the shader a constant in VGPR you won&#39;t need until the end of the shader.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The scheduling problem for SI can distinguish three main parts:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . Hiding high latencies (texture sampling, etc)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . Hiding low latencies (SGPR constant loading, etc)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . Keeping register usage low for better latency hiding and general</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   performance</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Some other things can also affect performance, but are hard to predict</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (cache usage, the fact the HW can issue several instructions from different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// wavefronts if different types, etc)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This scheduler tries to solve the scheduling problem by dividing it into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// simpler sub-problems. It divides the instructions into blocks, schedules</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// locally inside the blocks where it takes care of low latencies, and then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// chooses the order of the blocks by taking care of high latencies.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Dividing the instructions into blocks helps control keeping register</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// usage low.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// First the instructions are put into blocks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   We want the blocks help control register usage and hide high latencies</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   later. To help control register usage, we typically want all local</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   computations, when for example you create a result that can be consumed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   right away, to be contained in a block. Block inputs and outputs would</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   typically be important results that are needed in several locations of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   the shader. Since we do want blocks to help hide high latencies, we want</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   the instructions inside the block to have a minimal set of dependencies</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   on high latencies. It will make it easy to pick blocks to hide specific</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   high latencies.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   The block creation algorithm is divided into several steps, and several</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   variants can be tried during the scheduling process.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Second the order of the instructions inside the blocks is chosen.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   At that step we do take into account only register usage and hiding</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   low latency instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Third the block order is chosen, there we try to hide high latencies</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and keep register usage low.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// After the third step, a pass is done to improve the hiding of low</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// latencies.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Actually when talking about &#39;low latency&#39; or &#39;high latency&#39; it includes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// both the latency to get the cache (or global mem) data go to the register,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and the bandwidth limitations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Increasing the number of active wavefronts helps hide the former, but it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// doesn&#39;t solve the latter, thus why even if wavefront count is high, we have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to try have as many instructions hiding high latencies as possible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The OpenCL doc says for example latency of 400 cycles for a global mem</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// access, which is hidden by 10 instructions if the wavefront count is 10</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Some figures taken from AMD docs:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Both texture and constant L1 caches are 4-way associative with 64 bytes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// lines.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Constant cache is shared with 4 CUs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For texture sampling, the address generation unit receives 4 texture</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// addresses per cycle, thus we could expect texture sampling latency to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// equivalent to 4 instructions in the very best case (a VGPR is 64 work items,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instructions in a wavefront group are executed every 4 cycles),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or 16 instructions if the other wavefronts associated to the 3 other VALUs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the CU do texture sampling too. (Don&#39;t take these figures too seriously,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// as I&#39;m not 100% sure of the computation)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Data exports should get similar latency.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For constant loading, the cache is shader with 4 CUs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The doc says &quot;a throughput of 16B/cycle for each of the 4 Compute Unit&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// I guess if the other CU don&#39;t read the cache, it can go up to 64B/cycle.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It means a simple s&#95;buffer&#95;load should take one instruction to hide, as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// well as a s&#95;buffer&#95;loadx2 and potentially a s&#95;buffer&#95;loadx8 if on the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// cache line.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// As of today the driver doesn&#39;t preload the constants in cache, thus the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// first loads get extra latency. The doc says global memory access can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 300-600 cycles. We do not specially take that into account when scheduling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// As we expect the driver to be able to preload the constants soon.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// common code //</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SIScheduleBlock::tryCandidateTopDown(SISchedCandidate &amp;Cand,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          SISchedCandidate &amp;TryCand) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Initialize the candidate if needed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Cand.isValid()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlight">    TryCand.Reason = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06a31669aae44fa7e6414dd5cd81e2b16f8">NodeOrder</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Cand.SGPRUsage &gt; 60 &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sisched/#ac6bcd3ad1ec3f1be308048693474bd19">SISched::tryLess</a>(TryCand.SGPRUsage, Cand.SGPRUsage,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlight">                       TryCand, Cand, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06aefdc051657574f00e43b0fa1f87e7336">RegUsage</a>))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Schedule low latency instructions as top as possible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Order of priority is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . Low latency instructions which do not depend on other low latency</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   instructions we haven&#39;t waited for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . Other instructions which do not depend on low latency instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   we haven&#39;t waited for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . Low latencies</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// . All other instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Goal is to get: low latency instructions - independent instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     - (eventually some more low latency instructions)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     - instructions that depend on the first low latency instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If in the block there is a lot of constant loads, the SGPR usage</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// could go quite high, thus above the arbitrary limit of 60 will encourage</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// use the already loaded constants (in order to release some SGPRs) before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loading more.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sisched/#ac6bcd3ad1ec3f1be308048693474bd19">SISched::tryLess</a>(TryCand.HasLowLatencyNonWaitedParent,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">                       Cand.HasLowLatencyNonWaitedParent,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">                       TryCand, Cand, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">SIScheduleCandReason::Depth</a>))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sisched/#a0fc548582a68bc6e9519f88a7484ab71">SISched::tryGreater</a>(TryCand.IsLowLatency, Cand.IsLowLatency,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          TryCand, Cand, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">SIScheduleCandReason::Depth</a>))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (TryCand.IsLowLatency &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sisched/#ac6bcd3ad1ec3f1be308048693474bd19">SISched::tryLess</a>(TryCand.LowLatencyOffset, Cand.LowLatencyOffset,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sisched/#ac6bcd3ad1ec3f1be308048693474bd19">SISched::tryLess</a>(TryCand.VGPRUsage, Cand.VGPRUsage,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Fall through to original instruction order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (TryCand.SU-&gt;NodeNum &lt; Cand.SU-&gt;NodeNum) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">    TryCand.Reason = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06a31669aae44fa7e6414dd5cd81e2b16f8">NodeOrder</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (SUnit&#42; SU : TopReadySUs) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlight">    SISchedCandidate TryCand;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlight">    std::vector&lt;unsigned&gt; pressure;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Predict register usage after this instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">    TryCand.SU = SU;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlight">    TopRPTracker.getDownwardPressure(SU-&gt;getInstr(), pressure, MaxPressure);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">    TryCand.LowLatencyOffset = DAG-&gt;LowLatencyOffset&#91;SU-&gt;NodeNum&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">    TryCand.HasLowLatencyNonWaitedParent =</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlight">    tryCandidateTopDown(TopCand, TryCand);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (TryCand.Reason != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06af9883480b45663348fb5529c563fd6f2">NoCand</a>)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SIScheduleBlock::initRegPressure(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> BeginBlock,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> EndBlock) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlight">  IntervalPressure Pressure, BotPressure;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlight">  RegPressureTracker RPTracker(Pressure), BotRPTracker(BotPressure);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlight">  LiveIntervals &#42;LIS = DAG-&gt;getLIS();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlight">  MachineRegisterInfo &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64advsimdscalarpass-cpp/#aacd2ab195054a3e6a74bfbb9d5d571c8">MRI</a> = DAG-&gt;getMRI();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlight">  DAG-&gt;initRPTracker(TopRPTracker);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlight">  DAG-&gt;initRPTracker(BotRPTracker);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlight">  DAG-&gt;initRPTracker(RPTracker);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Goes though all SU. RPTracker captures what had to be alive for the SUs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to execute, and what is still alive at the end.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (SUnit&#42; SU : ScheduledSUnits) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">    RPTracker.setPos(SU-&gt;getInstr());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlight">    RPTracker.advance();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Close the RPTracker to finalize live ins/outs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlight">  RPTracker.closeRegion();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Initialize the live ins and live outs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlight">  TopRPTracker.addLiveRegs(RPTracker.getPressure().LiveInRegs);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlight">  BotRPTracker.addLiveRegs(RPTracker.getPressure().LiveOutRegs);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Do not Track Physical Registers, because it messes up.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;RegMaskPair : RPTracker.getPressure().LiveInRegs) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (RegMaskPair.RegUnit.isVirtual())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlight">      LiveInRegs.insert(RegMaskPair.RegUnit);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlight">  LiveOutRegs.clear();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There is several possibilities to distinguish:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1) Reg is not input to any instruction in the block, but is output of one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2) 1) + read in the block and not needed after it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 3) 1) + read in the block but needed in another block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 4) Reg is input of an instruction but another block will read it too</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 5) Reg is input of an instruction and then rewritten in the block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    result is not read in the block (implies used in another block)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 6) Reg is input of an instruction and then rewritten in the block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    result is read in the block and not needed in another block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 7) Reg is input of an instruction and then rewritten in the block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    result is read in the block but also needed in another block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LiveInRegs will contains all the regs in situation 4, 5, 6, 7</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We want LiveOutRegs to contain only Regs whose content will be read after</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in another block, and whose content was written in the current block,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that is we want it to get 1, 3, 5, 7</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Since we made the MIs of a block to be packed all together before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// scheduling, then the LiveIntervals were correct, and the RPTracker was</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// able to correctly handle 5 vs 6, 2 vs 3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (Note: This is not sufficient for RPTracker to not do mistakes for case 4)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The RPTracker&#39;s LiveOutRegs has 1, 3, (some correct or incorrect)4, 5, 7</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Comparing to LiveInRegs is not sufficient to differentiate 4 vs 5, 7</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The use of findDefBetween removes the case 4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;RegMaskPair : RPTracker.getPressure().LiveOutRegs) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/mem2reg-cpp/#a6fde3eb6ca09ddf2fd76432176d817bb">Register</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinesink-cpp/#a359e1ff26f6d466d927a61aae45b05c3">Reg</a> = RegMaskPair.RegUnit;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinesink-cpp/#a359e1ff26f6d466d927a61aae45b05c3">Reg</a>.isVirtual() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="#a9dbfc6f968f0d6cbfd77760b62a9b552">isDefBetween</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinesink-cpp/#a359e1ff26f6d466d927a61aae45b05c3">Reg</a>, LIS-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals/#a6f3043b29023d270fc4bc5062dff7cee">getInstructionIndex</a>(&#42;BeginBlock).<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex/#ae3b98982e2036f3d26806de5ed5e02d0">getRegSlot</a>(),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     LIS-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals/#a6f3043b29023d270fc4bc5062dff7cee">getInstructionIndex</a>(&#42;EndBlock).<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex/#ae3b98982e2036f3d26806de5ed5e02d0">getRegSlot</a>(), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64advsimdscalarpass-cpp/#aacd2ab195054a3e6a74bfbb9d5d571c8">MRI</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     LIS)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SIScheduleBlockCreator::colorHighLatenciesGroups() &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="653"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> GroupSize;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="654"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-aarch64a57fploadbalancing-cpp-/#afcb9ac67c90816f55d217d4f629e1047">Color</a> = NextReservedID;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NumHighLatencies == 0)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NumHighLatencies &lt;= 6)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="673"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SUNum : DAG-&gt;TopDownIndex2SU) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DAG-&gt;IsHighLatencySU&#91;SU.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit/#a3f708b119627541f144d703a1d183202">NodeNum</a>&#93;) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="677"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CompatibleGroup = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ProposedColor = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-aarch64a57fploadbalancing-cpp-/#afcb9ac67c90816f55d217d4f629e1047">Color</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><span class="doxyHighlight">      std::vector&lt;int&gt; AdditionalElements;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We don&#39;t want to put in the same block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// two high latency instructions that depend</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00683" /><CodeLine lineNumber="683"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// on each other.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// One way would be to check canAddEdge</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in both directions, but that currently is not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// enough because there the high latency order is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// enforced (via links).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Instead, look at the dependencies between the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="689"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// high latency instructions and deduce if it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="690"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a data dependency or not.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> j : FormingGroup) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> HasSubGraph;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><span class="doxyHighlight">        std::vector&lt;int&gt; SubGraph;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// By construction (topological order), if SU and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93; are linked, DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93; is necessary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the parent graph of SU.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><span class="doxyHighlight">        SubGraph = DAG-&gt;GetTopo()-&gt;GetSubGraph(SU, DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                               HasSubGraph);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!HasSubGraph);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><span class="doxyHighlight">        SubGraph = DAG-&gt;GetTopo()-&gt;GetSubGraph(DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93;, SU,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                               HasSubGraph);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!HasSubGraph)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No dependencies between each other</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (SubGraph.size() &gt; 5) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Too many elements would be required to be added to the block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><span class="doxyHighlight">          CompatibleGroup = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check the type of dependency</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> k : SubGraph) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If in the path to join the two instructions,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// there is another high latency instruction,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or instructions colored for another block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// abort the merge.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DAG-&gt;IsHighLatencySU&#91;k&#93; || (CurrentColoring&#91;k&#93; != ProposedColor &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          CurrentColoring&#91;k&#93; != 0)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><span class="doxyHighlight">            CompatibleGroup = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><span class="doxyHighlight">            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><span class="doxyHighlight">          &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If one of the SU in the subgraph depends on the result of SU j,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// there&#39;ll be a data dependency.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="#a628aa7dbdf88b477b398c62d1573d2e1">hasDataDependencyPred</a>(DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;k&#93;, DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93;)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><span class="doxyHighlight">            CompatibleGroup = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><span class="doxyHighlight">            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><span class="doxyHighlight">          &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!CompatibleGroup)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Same check for the SU</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="#a628aa7dbdf88b477b398c62d1573d2e1">hasDataDependencyPred</a>(SU, DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93;)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><span class="doxyHighlight">          CompatibleGroup = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Add all the required instructions to the block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// These cannot live in another block (because they</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// depend (order dependency) on one of the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a39d3d23a084c4544ee5903203db10e8a">llvm::append&#95;range</a>(AdditionalElements, SubGraph);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1096"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SIScheduleBlockCreator::colorExports() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ExportColor = NextNonReservedID++;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><span class="doxyHighlight">  SmallVector&lt;unsigned, 8&gt; ExpGroup;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Put all exports together in a block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The block will naturally end up being scheduled last,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// thus putting exports at the end of the schedule, which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is better for performance.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// However we must ensure, for safety, the exports can be put</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// together in the same block without any other instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This could happen, for example, when scheduling after regalloc</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if reloading a spilled register from memory using the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register than used in a previous export.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1328"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1333"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We do the final schedule for the instructions inside the block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1334"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The property that all the SUs of the Block are grouped together as MI</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1335"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is used for correct reg usage tracking.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1402"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1403"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Fill the usage of every output</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1404"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Warning: while by construction we always have a link between two blocks</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1405"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when one needs a result from the other, the number of users of an output</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1406"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is not the sum of child blocks having as input the same virtual register.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1407"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Here is an example. A produces x and y. B eats x and produces x&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1408"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// C eats x&#39; and y. The register coalescer may have attributed the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1409"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// virtual register to x and x&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1410"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To count accurately, we do a topological sort. In case the register is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1411"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// found for several parents, we increment the usage of the one with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1412"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// highest topological index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1413"><span class="doxyHighlight">  LiveOutRegsNumUsages.resize(Blocks.size());</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1424"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (topoInd &lt; BlocksStruct.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sischeduleblocks/#ab2c08a79b04d892064771771b1e85fe8">TopDownBlock2Index</a>&#91;Pred-&gt;getID()&#93;) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1426"><span class="doxyHighlight">          &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1427"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1428"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1429"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1430"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Found)</span></CodeLine>
